title: Italian Penicillin Soup for Comforting Recovery
promptIMG: Italian Penicillin Soup, on plate, natural food photography, balanced sharp focus, zero blur throughout entire image, infinite depth of field, realistic food textures, modern kitchen background in sharp focus, natural lighting, kitchen countertop visible, even focus distribution, documentary food photography, natural sharpness --no blur, depth of field, bokeh, over-sharpening, artificial enhancement --quality 2 --raw --stylize 300
description: This Italian Penicillin Soup is a soothing remedy when you're feeling under the weather. Packed with wholesome ingredients, it’s the perfect comfort food to warm you up. Try this easy recipe for a nourishing bowl that heals.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chopped carrots and celery, sautéing until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in diced tomatoes and vegetable broth, bringing to a simmer.
Add shrimp, dried basil, salt, and pepper, cooking for an additional 5-7 minutes until shrimp are pink and cooked through.
tips: For perfect results, ensure the shrimp are fresh and do not overcook them to maintain their tenderness.

structured_content.content: This Italian Penicillin Soup is a warm embrace on a chilly day. With its light yet flavorful broth, it’s designed to comfort and heal, making it the perfect remedy when you're feeling under the weather.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 30 minutes
  • Wholesome ingredients that are gentle on the stomach
  • Perfect for cozy dinners or when you're feeling unwell
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Rich in flavor while being light and nourishing

structured_content.content: I remember making this soup for my family when they were sick, and it always brought comfort and warmth. It’s a dish that not only nourishes the body but also the soul.

• Main ingredient: Fresh shrimp adds a delicate flavor and protein; ensure they are peeled and deveined for ease.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Dried basil enhances the soup's aroma; look for high-quality herbs.
  • Supporting ingredients: Carrots and celery provide texture and sweetness to the broth.
  • Equipment needed: A large pot for cooking and a sharp knife for chopping.

upload.context: A short description for the alt image of the ingredients preparation.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Chop the vegetables and prepare the shrimp. Heat olive oil in a pot.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Sauté the vegetables, add broth and tomatoes, then stir in shrimp until cooked through.
Finishing Touches:
Adjust seasoning and serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

upload.context: A short description for the alt image of the cooking process.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook shrimp just until pink to avoid toughness.
  • A common mistake is overcooking the shrimp; keep an eye on them.
  • The soup is ready when the shrimp are opaque and firm.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge for up to 2 days; reheat gently.

structured_content.content: This soup has been a family favorite for years. Sharing it with loved ones during tough times makes it even more special.
Enhance the soup with a squeeze of lemon juice or a sprinkle of fresh parsley for added brightness.
Serve with crusty bread or a fresh salad for a complete meal.
For a vegetarian version, replace shrimp with chickpeas and use vegetable broth.

upload.context: A short description for the alt image of the final plated dish or variation.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use homemade broth for the best flavor.
  • Prep all ingredients before starting to streamline the cooking process.
  • Timing is key; add shrimp at the end to keep them tender.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Enjoy making this comforting soup and feel the warmth it brings, both in flavor and in heart.
